intro: Buchnera physalodes, commonly known as the common bladderpod, is an annual flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its inflated, pod-like fruits that resemble bladders, which is where its common name originates. Its leaves are alternate and lobed, often with a hairy texture. Buchnera physalodes typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
